message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.SY

The paper proposes a method for learning reward functions from visual demonstrations, which is a problem commonly addressed in the machine learning community. The method leverages the abstraction power of intermediate visual representations learned by deep models, which suggests a focus on deep learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also applies the method to real-world robotic manipulation tasks, indicating a connection to robotics (cs.RO) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper addresses the problem of reward function design, which is a key issue in reinforcement learning (cs.SY). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, and cs.SY, in that order.
